body:
hi guys,

when I run daylight simulation one more time without changing the input data, I got different results.

as shown here, these are three different results of one situation, that I ran immediately after each other with no changes. this seems strange to me. 

thank you in advance for telling me whats wrong about it.

-masoumeh

replies.body: It's normal specially if Radiance parameters are set low. Search Grasshopper for "Stochastic Radiance" and you will find [similar discussions](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/page/search-results?cx=007664031582976519548%3A0mtws3t01h4&cof=FORID%3A10&ie=UTF-8&q=Stochastic+radiance&sa=Search&siteurl=www.grasshopper3d.com%2F&ref=www.grasshopper3d.com%2Fgroup%2Fladybug%2Fforum%2Ftopic%2Fshow%3Fid%3D2985220%253ATopic%253A1418152%26xg_source%3Dmsg&ss=4922j3167922j15).
thank you mostafa, learning this "Stochastic Sampling" was intresting for me!

Hi Mostapha,
I found out on another forum that it's possible to add a -u to the Radiance string in order to turn off the stochastic randomness. Is it possible to do it with HoneyBee as well?
I tried to put the "-u" into the _additionalIP input but it doesn't work.

Thanks in advance,
Claudio

Hi Claudio,

Definitely a limitation on our side. Radiance parameters only works for parameters that has a value to be set. Let me see what would be the best way to implement it to Honeybee RADParameters. I'll keep you posted.

[https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/433](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/433)

Hi Claudio, I added the functionality. Now you can add other additional parameters such as -u, -bv, -dv and -w. Give it a try and let me know if it works as expected. Cheers, Mostapha [](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2915573/11764916/1001374a-a112-11e5-877c-17e6b8295d61.png) [](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2915573/11764916/1001374a-a112-11e5-877c-17e6b8295d61.png)

Hi Mostapha, After a very short test I would say that it works fine. I'll let you know if I'll find bugs in the future. Thanks for adding it. I run optimization processes and it's good to be able to turn ON/OFF the randomness. Now we're able to close quickly the discussions like this one, started by masoumehta, just with a symple "it's Radiance randomness, just put a -u". And give a solution to people that struggle with it. Regards,
Claudio

Hi,

Is this possibility for adjusting randomness removed in the new version of honeybee?
